Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk selinux-policy
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: selinux-policy bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The selinux-policy packages contain the rules that govern how confined processes run on the system. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, without updated libcap-ng and policycoreutils packages, there was a privilege escalation due to the SECURE_NOROOT bit being used with the seunshare utility. With updated libcap-ng and policycoreutils packages, the PR_SET_NO_NEW_PRIVS bit is used instead to ensure that a process and its children can not gain new privileges. To reflect these changes, SELinux policy rules have been updated. As a result, all sandbox processes for the sandbox commands run within the same specific SELinux sandbox context providing the process isolation for sandbox processes altogether with private mounts of the /home/ and /tmp/ directories. (BZ#1261938) In Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, services without their own SELinux policy have the unconfined_service_t SELinux type. However, this type provides only a slight benefit coming with advanced process isolation provided by SELinux. With this update, new SELinux domains for the cgdcbxd and swift-container-reconciler processes have been added. (BZ#1072493, BZ#1189462) Previously, SELinux policy for Red Hat Gluster Storage (RHGS) components was missing, and Gluster worked correctly only when SELinux was in permissive mode. With this update, SELinux policy rules for the glusterd (glusterFS Management Service), glusterfsd (NFS sever), smbd, nfsd, rpcd, adn ctdbd processes have been updated providing SELinux support for Gluster. (BZ#1191989, BZ#1212923, BZ#1224879, BZ#1229279, BZ#1230369, BZ#1232692, BZ#1240584, BZ#1241095, BZ#1241400, BZ#1242476, BZ#1244272) Users of selinux-policy are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
